instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message:
Checked under microscope no liquid damage. get orange light. fan spins for a half second a every couple of seconds.

PPBUS - 8.59v
PPVCC_S0_CPU - pulses at 1.6v when fan spins(i'm assuming this is vcore?)
ALL_SYS_PWGD - Puleses at 3.3V
Pin 8 on u1950 - 3.34 but drops every second.

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: Pin 8 of U1950 goes directly to 3V42 as you can see. This would mean 3V42 rail must be pulsing too.

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: any suggestions on where i should start to fix 3v42?  never had a pulsing rail before.

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: Is 3V42 really pulsing the the first question or is it a dodgy measuring on U1950.

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: double checked it ....sorry looks like i messed up on the measuring.

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: So the usual power cycling. Check the usual suspect, J6100, U6100 and termination resistors, U1950, U1900 and traces. Known good BIOS?

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: ill check the rest.  how can i tell if bios is good?  The board has never been touched.  and no water damage.

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: Swap BIOS chip with a known good one. Of course only for testing as the original BIOS will then need fixing.

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: okay just received a few dead boards from china.  I know its stupid question but just to make sure bios is u6100 right

threads.title: 820-3437 No boot
threads.message: U6100 is the ROM indeed. Make sure the ROM actually is good, donor boards may have the ROM erased or corrupted.
